content: Over VNC?
Pavel Kalian has marked this topic as resolved.

FYI:
On Rpi5 I today tested Wayland instead of X11. Although not ready it's better than for some months ago.
All MUI menus and Options works OK.
Charts and ships are fine.
Dialogs as Dashboard, Grib and AIS targets list are locked to screen center and can't be moved.
Interesting though that the dialog box for AIS target query can be moved and acts as expected.
I think that if you switch to labwc in raspi-config (Advanced Options -> Wayland, the third option), most if not all of this will be addressed.

Hmm..
No third option here:
bild.png

image.png
Looks like this for me on current Bookworm RPi OS.
I use to update using full-upgrade on my Bookworm. Are there more upgrade options to force the labwc to be included?
No idea, it simply was there when I put the card into my new Pi a few weeks ago. But if you have a system that is older maybe you will need to apt install labwc or something like that.
try sudo apt update && sudo apt install labwc
mid-air collision...
Thanks Alec. I searched and found it should be installed as you say. Now the third option is there. I'll test it...

Yes, the labwc is better. All dialogs, except grib, can be moved as normal and no other obstacles found so far.
On multi canvas the grib dialog can be moved inside the (left)canvas but not over the canvas border.
The (Real)VNC seems lost? "Cannot currently show the desktop"
I don't have any monitor, simply enabled VNC, which with wayland means WayVNC in raspi-config and it just works
What is broken in raspi-config is when you switch between Wayland and X11 it may then try to enable/disable wrong VNC service.
Do the Tooltips for the main toolbar display in the correct place?
yes

@Pavel Kalian
Of course I have to enable a lot things when now on Wayland instead, including VNC. Thanks.
@Dave Register
Tooltips: Well, sort of. First is the actual tips located beside the last visited menu item. After a second it's moved, up/down, to its correct position beside the cursor.

@Pavel Kalian
Where do you find the VNC preferences? On X11 it was an icon upper right but nothing here. I need to set the user and psw.
I log in using my normal system account

Just to restate, for posterity.
It looks like the default Wayland compositor does not know how to programmatically move TopLevelWindows.
And labwc evidently does.

Pavel..
Thanks. The Rpi system credentials worked here. As simple as that!

@Dave Register
More on Rpi 4-5 using Wayland-labWC:
The Console dialog is not correct positioned. It's near the center of the screen instead of along the right edge. And it can't be moved.
So I wouldn't say we are ready to recommend Wayland-labwc?
You are right, but it moves to the right position as soon as I move the main window, so it should be trivial to solve
Maybe still worth to do even for 5.10.2
23 messages were moved here from #OCPN 5.10 Release plan > Supported platforms by Alec Leamas.
2 messages were moved here from #OCPN 5.10 Release plan > ✔ (no topic) by Alec Leamas.

Agreed the console is positioned to the right edge when I resized the canvases by the middle divider.
For the grib dialog I couldn't find any similar method. It's locked to the left canvas and btw also covering the toolbox.
